resources.string: In the south of the province of Salamanca, in the heart of the Sierra de Francia, lies La Alberca, surrounded by extensive forests full of oak and chestnut trees. Sierra de Francia, lies La Alberca, surrounded by extensive forests full of oak and chestnut trees. Every corner of La Alberca has a special charm: its cobbled streets, its houses built of stone and wood and the roofs of the houses that and the roofs that are joined together in the air form an architectural ensemble in which to lose oneself and enjoy.\n

La Alberca, a magical setting, can boast of being the first village in Spain to be declared a Historic-Artistic Site in Spain, specifically in 1940. Its festivals, its traditions, such as the Moza de Ánimas or the Marrano de San Antón, its gastronomy… so many reasons that will make your visit an incomparable experience. As the poet and professor from Alberca, Don José María Requejo, likes to say, La Alberca is… \n
Are you new here? Do you want to take a free tour through the app?
This is the home screen of the application. You will be able to access all the other sections of the application from here.
The albercan house had three main parts: the stable, the dwelling and the storage place.\\n

Every fairytale village must have a dream setting, and La Alberca is no exception. Forests of pine, oak and chestnut woods give life to the surroundings of this village, with all kinds of routes where you can enjoy nature, the fauna and the pure air they offer us. \n
"If you want to spend more than one day in La Alberca to discover all its secrets, there are many accommodation options: \n "
What do you want to tell us?
What is the reason for your message?
The subject of the message cannot be empty
How to get to La Alberca?

The easiest way to get to La Alberca from the capital of the province is through the SA-215 highway, to the town of Tamames, where we will take the detour to the SA-201, which will take us to our destination after traveling 76 km. that separate Salamanca from La Alberca.\n
If you do not have your own vehicle to come to La Alberca or simply want to come by bus, there are bus lines with different round-trip schedules to visit the town:\n
La Alberca is located south of the province of Salamanca, bordering the province of Cáceres. Due to its bordering location, historically, La Alberca was known as the gate of Las Hurdes. \n
In the surroundings of La Alberca there are many other beautiful villages and places to discover. Here are a few options: \n
Villages of the Sierra de Francia

The gastronomy of the Sierra de Francia stands out for the high culinary value of the products used for its stews and delicacies, giving rise to preparations and products of the highest quality, which is why the recipes of the Sierra are so popular. \n

La Alberca is a village where you can eat a lot and eat well. Traditional dishes, grilled meats, homemade desserts, wines from the Sierra de Francia, tapas… a great gastronomic offer offered by the innkeepers who open the doors of their establishments every day to offer visitors the best of each house. \n

Las cárceles visitaba 
 con caridad peregrina 
 y su palabra divina 
 a los presos confortaba.
Click on the icons for more info.
No festivities were found this month…

This application was born out of love for a town, its people and its customs. I have been lucky enough to be part of them since I was born, and although it may sound cliché, there is no town that pampers its history and roots more than La Alberca. 

I would like to thank all the people who, directly or indirectly, have been involved in this crazy project. The time you have spent researching this wonderful village, the photographs you have taken of it and the dedication to spread the love you feel for La Alberca to the world have made the result of this application much better than I could have imagined. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. 

Thanks to my family and friends for their constant support and for the excitement of seeing the progress of each update of the application and seeing that in some way, they are represented in it.

Finally, thanks to my mother and my aunt Francis for being willing to collaborate at all times. This application is as much mine as it is yours.

Thanks to you, who are behind the screen of your device reading this, you are the main reason why this application exists. Now you only have one mission left:
What would a village be without its grocery stores, craft shops, bakeries…? Fortunately, in La Alberca we have a large selection of them, where both locals and onlookers can enjoy local products:\n

Village festivals are synonymous with tradition, culture and recreation, but they are also the ideal setting for the people to escape from the rigidity of their daily lives. 

All regional festivals are similar and all are special in their richness, which is why they deserve as much pampering as any other type of cultural heritage worth preserving, passing them on from generation to generation.

Urban life and other phenomena such as emigration, tourism and even television have led to the disuse of words that rural life used to give names to everyday utensils, tasks or clothing. 

Although these words will eventually disappear, there are still many locals who use the rural language they learnt in their childhood. Here we want to make room for this peculiar lexicon:
Click on the image for more info.
Sure you want to go out?

Chapel of the Virgin of Dolores

Discovering La Alberca is nothing more than a Final Degree project with the desire and great expectations of becoming something important in the future. 

 Its creator? 

 Me. My name is Leire, I am 24 years old and since a few years ago I have been studying a degree in Computer Engineering specialising in Management and Information Systems at the School of Engineering in Bilbao. 

 I have always liked to carry my town as a flag, to show it off and make it known to the world. For this reason, it was always clear to me that my final degree project would in some way be a tribute to it. Thanks to this, in September 2022 Descubriendo La Alberca was born. 

 I hope that this application will help you, dear reader, to understand the love, respect and admiration of the people of La Alberca for their town, for their home.
The email address you entered is invalid. Please try again.
The email address you entered is not correct. Please try again.
Which section would you like to access?
What do you wish to do?

La Alberca and sport have always been closely linked. From hiking routes, to popular races, cycling events and football championships, La Alberca can boast of having been part of the route of the Vuelta Ciclista a España on several occasions. What\'s more, La Alberca can boast of having formed part of the route of the Vuelta Ciclista a España (Tour of Spain) on several occasions. \n

But without a doubt, until a few years ago, the sporting event par excellence in La Alberca and the Sierra de Francia has been the Tres Valles mountain race: an authentic endurance event with a variety of distances for all types of runners, with routes of infinite beauty through the Sierra de Francia Natural Park and the Las Batuecas Valley.\n

The great landscape of the Sierra de Francia makes it the ideal place to practice a multitude of sports and leisure activities. for a multitude of sports and outdoor adventure activities. Among the most adventurous activities that can be carried out in the Sierra de Francia include climbing, abseiling, trekking, canoeing, zip-lining, mountain biking, horse riding, canyoning, archery and rafting, most of which are offered by local businesses. \n
For example, if you would like to spend an afternoon full of fun in nature, you can go to the Parque de Aventura en Árboles de Las Batuecas in La Alberca, where the trees are the protagonists. \n

In addition, in La Alberca you can also enjoy more traditional sports such as football, basketball, bowls, petanque or frontenis, thanks to the different leisure infrastructures offered by the town. \n
Select one of the following list

In addition to La Alberca, in the Sierra de Francia we can find 14 other villages where you can breathe culture and tradition, all different from each other but with something in common: the love and loyalty to their roots and to their Sierra de Francia.\n
Are you sure you want to change this record?
Are you sure you want to delete this record?
Select one of the following options

Many illustrious and famous people have visited La Alberca, have made reference to it in their writings, have left portraits of its people and landscapes or have used the town and its surroundings to shoot their films or documentaries. Ortega y Gasset, Miguel de Unamuno, Maurice Legendre, Luis Buñuel... all very important names who left their mark in La Alberca. \n

Father Don Luis de Hoyos (1894-1976), a Dominican religious, writer and publisher, is another of the most famous people in La Alberca. He wrote several books about the history, physiognomy, life and folklore of La Alberca, such as La Alberca: Vida y Folklore, the first book to go down in history as the first in the collection of cultural books in digital format of the publications service of the Diputación de Salamanca, with a prologue by José Luis Puerto, a native of La Alberca. \n

Jose Luis Puerto was born in La Alberca in 1953. Poet, ethnographer, professor of Spanish language and literature, among other things, he was named "Premio ciudad de Segovia de poesía", "Premio de poesía Jaime Gil de Bedmia" and "Premio Castilla y León de las letras" for the whole of his works, he carries La Alberca as a flag in his literary works. \n
Painters such as Sorolla, José Guerrero and Ismael Blat also passed through La Alberca and made this town the muse of their works. \n

The fact that La Alberca is such a picturesque village has meant that it has been the setting for numerous films, series and TV programmes. Famous films such as Tierra Sin Pan, filmed in 1932 by Luis Buñuel, Marcelino Pan y Vino, filmed in 1955, or La Marrana, starring Alfredo Landa and Antonio Resines, have used the streets and squares of La Alberca as a backdrop. \n

As for television programmes, Masterchef, Maestros de la Costura, España Directo or El Paisano are some of the many that have wanted to soak up the traditions, gastronomy and craftsmanship of La Alberca. In addition, major production companies such as Netflix have chosen this special enclave as the setting for their series, such as the Netflix series "Once Upon a Time, But No More" in which we can see several places in the village. \n

Its streets and surroundings have also served as inspiration for many writers who have wanted to reflect the history and customs of the place in their books. In verse or prose, faithful to the history and daily life of its inhabitants, such as La Madre de los Aires by the Alberca writer José Luis Puerto, in which he recalls his peasant childhood, or La Alberca: Vida y costumbre, by Padre Hoyos, as well as the occasional mystery novel, such as La Prisionera de la Cumbre Nevada, by the writer Christian Furquet. \n
La Alberca is also the scene of other cultural aspects that do not reflect the history, tradition or customs of the town. Here are a few of them:\n
